producers.name: Buysse, D. J., Reynolds, C. F., Monk, T. H., Berman, S. R., Kupfer, D. J.

title_statement.title: PSQI: Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index
title_statement.subtitle: Comprehensive self-report measure of sleep quality

study_info.abstract: The PSQI is a 19-item self-report questionnaire designed to assess sleep quality and sleep disturbances over a one-month time interval. It examines both objective and subjective sleep quality through seven component scores. Widely used in sleep research and clinical practice for identifying sleep disorders.

instrument_details.interpretation: 0-5: Good sleep quality; >5: Poor sleep quality

psychometric_properties.validity: High sensitivity (0.89-0.90) and specificity (0.87-0.94) for sleep disorders
